str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Ready, prepared. From an old noun heteos; adjusted, i.e. Ready.
To give justice over, defend, avenge, vindicate. From ekdikos; to vindicate, retaliate, punish.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Disobedience, imperfect hearing. From parakouo; inattention, i.e. disobedience.
When, whenever. From hote and an; whenever; also causatively inasmuch as.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Obedience, submissiveness, compliance. From hupakouo; attentive hearkening, i.e. compliance or submission.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
